turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I'm still okay.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Inform him the fee is seventy-five large for your return.  All parts intact.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He wants 75 back.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Plus names, addresses and I.D. for the lot of you.  We're in this together and I need to know who my partners are.  In case I ever need to roll over on somebody.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Did you hear that?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Let me talk to him.  Hold the phone to my ear -- but don't nudge me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It could be a fire.  This is Malibu.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: No, there's a police car way back there.  See it, in the distance coming around the turn?  The van is blocking it now.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's Nels' number?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Dial him up.  We need him to run interference.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Do you think they'll walk away?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Ask them.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They'll have units blocking us up ahead.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's why we're turning off onto a fire road.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Some people fall apart in a pinch. But you shine.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I can't hear.  Now there's a siren.  They must be in an ambulance.  What about the money?  Nels?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Wonderful feeling of security knowing your adversaries are both crippled and unarmed.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The money, Nels ... ?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Any idea where you're going?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I was sentenced to a youth camp out here when I was fourteen.  We cleared some of these same roads.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: They did some great job of reforming you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's where this Chicano correctional officer first taught me to slap paint on a canvas.  I could copy any fucking thing he put in front of me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Think you could do a picture of me?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I had it in my mind what you'd look like.  "Her," I could've painted.  <u>You</u>, I'd be afraid to turn my back to mix the colors.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Developer ran out of money years back.  I'd hate to think about what's living in there.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Why are we stopping?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I need a break.  I've been on a marathon run ever since I had the misfortune to strike up a conversation with you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who'd ever think, to look at you?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: As a child I hated being told how sweet I looked.  That angelic little face wasn't me at all.  I had to hurt people to prove to them they had the wrong image. Sometimes words were enough -- but I wasn't beyond inflicting physical pain in order to be taken seriously.  I enjoyed seeing the shock on their poor faces when they realized who I was.  That same look you gave me when I turned the gun on you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You've had a lot of fun with me today.  What would you have done if I hadn't responded to your call?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: We had a backup plan.  But I knew you'd come through for me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yeah, I was waiting for that suggestion.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Sooner or later you'll learn to trust me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How about "later?"

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's really on your wicked little mind?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: The cop in the trunk -- he could still be alive.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's a reasonable possibility.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He might've heard everything we said in the car.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What's your point?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: We can't leave him to repeat anything.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Which one of us is elected to do the deed?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You're the man with the gun.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Naturally.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Naturally.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Maybe your friends already accomplished that chore for us.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Only one way to find out.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm going to cuff you and leave you in that house.  It may take awhile but you'll be found after we're long gone.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: That's not good enough.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's how it's going to be.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm handling it.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: He let the fucking cop out -- but he won't --

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Both hands on your lap.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nothing but CDs in there.  I thought maybe you'd like some Celine or Whitney.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Just sitting here listening to her voice does it to me all over again.  No harm admitting I fell in love with the sound of you.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: That's a skill you acquire when you do fantasy phone sex for a living. I must've had thirty regulars salivating at 4.99 per minute.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Some nice fantasy you all cooked up for me.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Took preparation.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Exactly who was this Oberfeld?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Local lawyer for Dominican dealers.  Off to buy a half interest in a mall in Granada Hills on their behalf.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Know what else is in here?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Take your hand out of there. Slowly.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Think about what's going to happen to your valuables when that trunk flies open at 75 miles per?

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: You won't live to see it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's going to be some fucking snowstorm.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Pull over!  Pull over someplace.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: Five ... six.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Toss them -- one at a time.  I don't want to lose count.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I picked the wrong number when I chose you ... didn't I?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Turns out you did me a favor. You're looking at a rich man.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: -- The phones, Theo.  Don't leave any of them behind.  The cops could pull up a record of all our calls and -- find you.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I've got ... one last number for you, Theo ...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't want it.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: My fence in San Francisco ... 305-4410.  Maurice.  Don't take less than a third on the face value of those bonds.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Sure, like I'm gonna take advice from you.

turns.speaker: LENORE
turns.text: I told you ... sooner or later you'd have to trust me ...

turns.speaker: LENORE'S VOICE
turns.text: Thank God -- thank God I've got you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: LENORE'S VOICE
turns.text: You mustn't hang up.

turns.speaker: LENORE'S VOICE
turns.text: Oh God -- Oh no -- Help me -- Don't let me -- Die.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Didn't we play this scene before?

turns.speaker: LENORE'S VOICE
turns.text: Don't leave me here to die -- Theo, please -- you can't let me die --

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm afraid I've used up all my good deeds for the day.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Who are you working for?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm self employed.  What kind of cut did the hairy one have?

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Twenty percent.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Fine.  I want half.  Plus the release of the family.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Whatever you say.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're making it too easy.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: You got time on your side.  Pretty soon they'll be missed and we'll have the law up our ass.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: They saw you kill the driver.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: You're up on your details, aren't you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You can rely on them to keep quiet because this is undeclared money that could land Jack there in federal prison.  He can't afford for you to get caught and have this briefcase appear as evidence.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Keep talking.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're walking away with a clear fifty percent and a guarantee nobody can afford to I.D. you.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: There are no guarantees in this life.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Granted.  But I don't believe they're grieving enough for their chauffeur to piss away their own futures.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Where do we meet?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's a nice day.  How about the beach?

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Pass.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: A large stretch of empty space with no place to hide.  Temescal Canyon parking lot.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: What time frame have you got in mind?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It should take me twenty minutes. Where are you coming from?

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: We can be there.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I want you all in one vehicle. Your van.  If I see anybody else cruising around I'll keep going. No second chances.  You can kill them and I'll keep what I've got.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Some loyalty.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: There's no loyalty at the expense of my own ass.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tell the lady to relax.  Tell her I can't wait to meet her in person.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: She's somewhat damaged in the shipping.  But nothing makeup won't cover.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Got a phone in that van?

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Take my number.  When you see me -- call me and I'll walk you through the exchange.  It's 308-9962 -- Repeat it back.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Beats yelling our brains out across some parking lot.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: You're getting a lot of mileage out of that cellular.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I wish it had never been invented.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm here.  Where are you?

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: We don't see you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm three quarters of the way up the lot behind the concession stand.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Stay there.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't want you within two hundred feet.  Park down by the lifeguard station.  Nobody gets out.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: It's your call.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Fucking "A" it is!  Any argument and I'm out of here.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Just relax.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't need to relax.  The woman. Put her on.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: You'll see her.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't want to see her later.  I want to hear her <u>now</u>.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Talk to the man.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Satisfied?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You already tried to pull one little number on me -- and it didn't work.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: I don't know what you mean.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I still don't see you.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: We're waiting for the light to cross the highway.  It just changed.  We're in a grey van.  It reads "<u>Noble Carpet Cleaners</u>."

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: We're waiting on you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then just wait.  I'm counting this all out and deducting my share. While I'm at it you can be getting that tape off the lady.  And her little girl.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: It's in the process.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I make my end of the cash at 184,000.  Now I'm trying to figure out the bonds.  What the face value is.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: You should've done all this before.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not accepting criticism today. Now don't make me lose count. There's already a half million in this portfolio.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Her husband said there'd be one million eight.  So nine hundred to you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: My pleasure --

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Be careful in disposing of them. You'll have to discount 'em. You'll be lucky to clear a hundred and a quarter.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Thanks for the sound advice.  Now ask the woman to get out of the van and walk over here.  Alone.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Negative.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You'll still have the girl and the husband.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: And not a nickel.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Soon as Mrs. Oberfeld is in my car I'll toss out your first third. Then I'll back up 200 feet to behind the public restroom.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: And then?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You pull up -- collect your first installment.  Then you let the daughter go.  When she reaches me, I'll dump out another third.  Same action.  I back up again -- you pull forward.  Satisfy yourself it's there.  Then we do it one last time.  The final exchange. And we go our separate ways.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: And they run straight to the cops who start looking for our van.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I won't let 'em.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: I'm opening the side door.  She'll step out.  But before she gets in your vehicle I want to see the first installment put down in plain view.  If it isn't there I'm shooting her in the back.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Are you trying to panic the women?

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: That's how it is.  You see her approaching you toss out installment one.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm tying it up in a bundle now. Where is she?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Stop the crying.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: She's yours.  What are we waiting on?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm backing up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Count it.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Don't worry.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Next I want to see Rachel.  Put her on the phone before she gets out so her mother can tell her exactly what to do.  Keep her calm.  Tell her you're fine and that she can join you in this car.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Seems like it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Put the girl on.

turns.speaker: MALE VOICE
turns.text: Yeah.  Why don't we?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What are you planning to do when they got here?  They'll kill us. They'll kill Rachel.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: What's he doing?  Answer me!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Better reassure him.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who am I talking to?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Call me "Nels."

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Okay Nels, you can always keep what you've got and haul ass leaving the lovely lady for me to worry about.  I'll bet she can be friendly when it's in her best interests.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: If you're looking for a quickie all you've got to do is ask.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I think I've already had a "quickie."  Thank you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: If he pulls me over he gets all the proceeds plus Lenore here.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: And if you ditch us we get zilch.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Sure, I end up with some cash. And a lot of bonds I don't know how to dispose of.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're going to have to see to it that both lanes of this road get blocked.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: The fuck I will!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's in your interest, Nels, since the additional passenger in my trunk -- an LAPD officer is probably carrying a few bullets in him traceable to the piece you're carrying.  Tell the man.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You researched me.  You know where I live.  She'll be waiting for you there along with your split.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: There's two police cars now.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tailgate me.  I'll jam on the brakes.  You go into a spin to avoid an accident and cut them off.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: You want us to get ourselves killed?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: From what I can see you're a pretty fair wheelman.  There's a hairpin coming up -- that's the place for it. The cops'll plow right into you.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: And I end up in a fucking neck brace for life!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then you can sue the cops. Collect from both ends.  Tighten your belts.  Here it comes.  Ready?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: I just strolled out of the emergency room while they were admitting Rodriego.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You couldn't be calling at a worse time, Nels.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nels!  Guess who?  A friendly voice from beyond the grave.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I thought you'd know me by now.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: What does it take to kill you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I suppose you're in your taxi?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Why would she want me to think you were on ice?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Intelligent question, Nels.  I believe she had plans for both our bodies to be found in close proximity.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: That bitch.  What's keeping you from taking off?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: My compensation!  Somebody still owes me -- big time!

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: I can see the benefit in that.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You could always disappear with what's already in your backpack.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Not without the name of the contact who can discount the bonds.  I may need to pry that information out of her.  What do you stand to gain?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Sweet revenge plus maybe a bit of vigorish off your end.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: In the hills above Sunset.  Just below the Getty.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Take the 405 south.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How far off are you?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Five minutes.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where do I turn?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Take the Getty Center exit -- make a right onto Cisco.  It'll be a narrow winding road.  You can't miss the house.  It's a mansion built back in '29 -- Spanish -- boarded up since the quake.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Have your cab wait at the foot of Cisco -- we'll ride up together.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: And make ourselves a hell of a target.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: We're gonna get there first.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Believe me.  They couldn't be busier at the moment.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Better haul ass if we're gonna be inside to greet them.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: I've got a couple of spare pieces stashed under the floorboards.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where's the backpack?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: None of your business, but it's in the cab.  That's all mine.  When we take from them, we divide, eighty-twenty.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: At those prices I'd just as soon your cabbie didn't get a look at me.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Probably as close to the Getty as I'll ever come.  Unless you care to be my "patron," Nels.  You wouldn't be the first successful thief to become a patron of the arts.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: In your dreams.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't underestimate me.  I've got original ideas of my own.  Warhol got famous doing a soup can.  What would you think of a cellular phone done in acrylics?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Are you busting my chops or what?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Somebody better tear this down before it falls down.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Stay put!  I know my way around.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who were you talking to?

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Them.  They won't be expecting us.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Brilliant -- unless they were close enough to see the cab pull away.  In which case you just warned them.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Nobody can do anything right but you!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm in awe.

turns.speaker: NELSON
turns.text: Following which we will have a serious question and answer session with your girlfriend.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Since when did you guys start changing tires?

turns.speaker: OFFICER GRILLO
turns.text: Only you <u>don't</u> have a flat.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Seems not.

turns.speaker: OFFICER GRILLO
turns.text: If you weren't going for a spare what were you doing?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Something was rattling around. Some loose tools.

turns.speaker: OFFICER GRILLO
turns.text: Mind if I have a look?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why are you picking on me for?

turns.speaker: OFFICER GRILLO
turns.text: Was I picking on you?  How come you pulled in back of this fruitstand?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tell the truth, I was going to take a much needed leak.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't be afraid to say hello. Your friend with the recent transplant is in no condition to deliver that briefcase.  So I've taken on the task.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Let me talk to the lady again.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: There's no lady here.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: If you've already killed her that's fine.  I'll keep the bonds and the cash.  We got nothing to discuss.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: If her kid or her old man have been harmed we've also got nothing to talk about.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Let her tell you.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: I already called for an ambulance.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You've got a <u>phone</u>?

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Doesn't everybody?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Can I make a quick call?

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Government business?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Very official.  259-7881, if I recall.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: What kind of Treasury Dept. business is this?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Undercover.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: I thought so.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Your partners are currently armed and we're not.  Our edge is that they don't know we're in touch.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: The 405 is coming up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where is this canyon house where you're supposed to hook up?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Let's have your name and address. The government will want to send you a letter of commendation.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Who the fuck you kidding?  Send me money!

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: You sure know how to take a lot of punishment.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: From here on, I dish it out.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Scottish?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: So can we consider you a regular, sir?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Is that good or bad?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Well, you get to say, The usual, Col. Things like that.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: So let's call this the usual.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: It takes all types.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: So who's he?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: He's what she should run a mile from.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Then why doesn't she?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Who knows the secrets of the human heart.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: She wants me to tell you go fuck yourself.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: You could always make it up to her.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: When a girl runs out like that, she generally wants to be followed.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: She's not a girl, Col --

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Whatever you say.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: See that, Col?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: See what, Dil?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: He gave me a look.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Did he?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Just cut his hair, you know.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: What you think?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Nice.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Saw that one.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: What would you call it?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Now, that was a look.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Now he can look.... Ask him does he like his hair, Col.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: She wants to know, sir, do you like your hair.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: He agreed that he was.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: What do you think his name is?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: I've no thoughts on the subject.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: That's what he said. Jimmy.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Hi, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: He's still looking, Col.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Persistent.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Good thing in a man.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: An excellent quality.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Maybe he wants something.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: I would expect he does.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Ask him.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Ask him yourself.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: He's back, Col

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Don't want any of those looks, Col. They don't mean much.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Stop it, Dil --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: No. Tell him to go fuck himself.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: You see that, Col?

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Saw it, Dil.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Fuck it, is what I say.

turns.speaker: COL
turns.text: Yeah. Fuck it, Dil.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Fucking men, Col --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Fuck off, Dave.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: C'mon, babe! You know what I like... Easy!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You fucking promised.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Did I?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: You fucking did.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Don't be like that --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: You heard me --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Who the fuck is he?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Jimmy.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: It's him, isn't it?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: See, they get the wrong idea.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Cunt.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Cunt. Scrag-eyed dyke cunt.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Charming.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: He's going to take his foot off slowly, David. Then you're to go home, like a good boy. You hear me?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Cunt.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Hey, Stirling fucking Moss --

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: It's Dave.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Sure, Dave --

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Please, Dil --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Take your clothes.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Don't throw my clothes out the window!

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Fuck off back to Essex!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Fucking mad!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Don't chuck my clothes out!

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Take your fucking goldfish, too!

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Look, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Fuck off, Dave.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: No, I won't fucking fuck off. Said I'm sorry, didn't I?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Yeah. I heard. You hear, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: It's not Pat. It's Jim.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Jim, Pat, Mick, what the fuck. Long as you remember you're not at Lords.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Do you mean that?

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: He wants to know do I mean that.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Is that his tart? Does Pat have a tart?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: She's not a tart.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: No, of course not, she's a lady.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: She's not that either.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Do it on your own time, Paddy.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Whatever it is she does for you.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: If I was her I'd consider that an insult.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Consider it how you like. Just get that bloody tart out of here.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: It's a simple question.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: How much did that frame cost, Mr. Franknum?

turns.speaker: FRANKNUM
turns.text: Two hundred quid, Mr. Deveroux.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Your Pat just cost me two hundred quid.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Sorry won't bring the bloody thing back, will it, Mr. Franknum?

turns.speaker: FRANKNUM
turns.text: Not in my experience.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Off his wages.

turns.speaker: FRANKNUM
turns.text: I'm sure you do, Mr. Deveroux.

turns.speaker: DEVEROUX
turns.text: Bloody right I do...

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Someone recommend you?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: In a way.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Guy I work with.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: What's his name?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Doesn't the water get to your nails?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: What's it to you?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: You American?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Not English.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Scottish?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: How'd you guess?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: The accent, I suppose.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: And what's it like?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Like treacle.
